Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; two added white lines near bottom of sherd; exterior: diagonal stroke pattern at top of rim above band of paired hook maeander pattern between pairs of lines; below, painted decoration consisting of goat (head, neck and shoulder with added red patch remaining), to right; elaborate circle and rosette as filling ornament; at right, vertical dividing bands, dot and billet and maeander.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as being in the style of the Würzburg chalices, but dated later than those chalices because she considers the style of the drawing to be debased and because of the elementary and isolated interior decoration (Lemos 1991, 72-3).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 43 note 96, p. 73, p. 235, no.146, pl. 13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0205) (phase 2)
